<<<code>>>: InputStream imageStream = conn.getInputStream();
ByteArrayOutputStream outputStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
byte[] buffer = new byte[1024];
int bytesRead;
while ((bytesRead = imageStream.read(buffer)) != -1) {
    outputStream.write(buffer, 0, bytesRead);
}
byte[] body = outputStream.toByteArray();
// handle error if necessary
return new ByteArrayInputStream(body);
<<<explanation>>>: This solution reads the input stream in chunks of 1024 bytes and writes them to a ByteArrayOutputStream. This allows you to handle the error if necessary and then create a ByteArrayInputStream from the byte array. This approach is safe to use for thumbnails of max 80kb size.
